DOC.detailed_description: This study determine feasibility , acceptability , preliminary effect size home-based individual breastfeeding consultation alone combine financial incentive increase breastfeeding ( BF ) duration among low-income Puerto Rican mother . These intervention test Women , Infants , Children ( WIC ) program , capitalize current goal WIC current practice use incentive support BF - factor likely increase potential sustainability dissemination intervention . We follow three phase strategy . During Formative Phase consult WIC staff , Puerto Rican postpartum mother , expert BF , behavioral health incentive , WIC population setting develop intervention research manual . During Implementation Phase , pilot intervention research procedure . We randomly assign 60 Puerto Rican woman initiate BF : Treatment-as-Usual ( TAU ) TAU financial incentive ( also know Contingency Management ; ( CM ) . A bilingual breastfeeding counselor visit participant home problem solve issue around breastfeed . Participants also receive CM receive cash incentive show breastfeed . We conduct assessment baseline , 1 , 3 , 6 month postpartum , measure BF duration , BF exclusivity , BF self-efficacy , infant weight gain . In Evaluative Phase , examine monthly recruitment , consent , enrollment rate , well attendance retention rate intervention research participation ( i.e. , feasibility acceptability ) .
